intro: Cakile bipinnata, commonly known as the bi-lobed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are bi-lobed and pinnately divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by round, pod-like fruits.
